I see your point, Tim, however,  I had not asked that question  directly 
u=
ntil after someone said something to me.   I asked only  to clarify somethi=
ng 
that was said earlier.  True, we do attract certain  people  to each of=
 us, 
you are attracting various types because you seem to  be one of those=
 doing 
the safe middle of the road system when it comes to  faith or relig=
ion, in 
that we all come from different schools of thought.  sf
 
 
In a m=
essage dated 6/9/2010 5:45:32 P.M. Eastern Daylight Time,  
tim@itcvoices.o=
rg writes:

 
 
 
I am by no means implying that you want to hear this kind=
 of thing!  

But, you are thinking about it at the time of your questionin=
g. Just  that 
simple act alone may be influencing the outcome of the commu=
nication's  
results. This is why I question the old trick of asking the bo=
x to tell you  
what is in your hand, because you already know! I think tha=
t the unconscious  
mind has a lot to do with the communication we receive =
but I cannot tell you  
exactly why.

Tim

yself much closer with atheism than  Christianity.

that the boxes tell us what  we want to hear. Why? I

 It could be spirits  playing with our heads, or, it 
could be 
> a piece o=
f our unconscious  coming through the radio. This does happen, I

corded the  voices of people in the same room with me coming 
through

th the  same speech patterns (although this happened twice with a Shack

hack  but I haven't had it happen with my Minibox yet). 
>

 if you ascribe to a belief and keep asking pointed 
questions

at belief over and over, do not be surprised when you hear what 
you

lieve coming through the box.
